intro: Cyrtandra lanata, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually pale green to white in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and moths. Cyrtandra lanata is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
